html:
9.17.20  12:57 am   O my Glob.
Outside of something I can't remember from "Seymour: An Introduction," this is one of the most profound Â¿philosphlets? on music I've ever:
" as soon as you start thinking of it as a 'chord progression' you'll lose 95% of the effectiveness of chords, for songs. just write songs, and use chords to get it done "
- ueqestion:   Is something similar true for "voicings," as you work through them?

        IE, does any given chord "grow itself" though internal relationships with it's neighborhood?
9.17.20  12:44 am   where do you stand on the issue?
9.16.20  11:51 pm   Does drinking water make you smarter?

9.16.20  11:28 pm   occasionally i perceive your songs as being sung by multiple people, in the story of the song. as in this verse is about and sung by this g, the next verse is about and sung by this other guy, the first chorus is this guy, etc. do you have any thoughts on this
